page.title: 10THE GROWTH OF OUNDLE 1
page.content: Unlike most of the villages in the area Oundle itself is a growing town with several new estates and more on the drawing board. There are several reasons for this expansion :- 1. The East Midlands in general is a growing area. This is part of the general drift of population to the south-east that has been going on since about 1918. 2. Peterborough is a rapidly expanding city with 'New Town' status so there is a lot of population movement into the area. However, many of the new-comers do not wish to live in the large new estates of the Ortons and instead move to smaller communities nearby. 3. After a decade of decline and uncertainty due to the closure of the steel industry, the Corby area has recently started to revive. .../...
